- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain Division I of Article II in Section 70 of the City of New Orleans Code, and to ordain new sections within that division. - Topic: Motion for Professional Services for Juvenile Intervention Services
- Summary: The motion seeks to enlist the services of a professional to conduct a survey of existing City or Juvenile Court administered and funded juvenile intervention services programming, budgetary allocations, and oversight entities. It also includes a performance analysis and recommended strategies for improving outcomes for children. The motion was referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee, received a questionnaire, recommended approval, and was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-158
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee and was adopted.
- UID: 530ccee4-052c-4232-a131-13ec6baa3ace

- Topic: Amendment to Classified Pay Plan (Library)
- Summary: The ordinance proposed amendments to the Classified Pay Plan (Library) for various positions, including changes to hiring rates and annual salaries, as adopted by the Civil Service Commission. The ordinance was recommended for approval by the Budget/Audit/Board of Review Committee and was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-197
- Votes Summary:

- Tags/Keywords: Classified Pay Plan, Library, Salary Amendments
- UID: 121fc045-cf6e-4790-92ba-3c40810fe77c

- Topic: Appointment to Industrial Development Board
- Summary: The ordinance ratified and approved the appointment of Ernest Gethers to fulfill the unexpired term of Eugene Green as a member of the Industrial Development Board. The appointment is effective upon approval by the Council of the City of New Orleans and will expire on January 1, 2027.

- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Ratification and approval of the appointment of Ernest Gethers to the Industrial Development Board.
- Tags/Keywords: Industrial Development Board, Appointment, Ernest Gethers

- Topic: Amendment to Section 2-975 of Article X of Chapter 2 of the City of New Orleans Code

- Ordinance Number: 33,639
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)

- Topic: Amendment to Section 147-2 of the City of New Orleans Code
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to amend regulations pertaining to the City's use of surveillance technology. The ordinance was referred to the Criminal Justice Committee and continued to the meeting of 5/5/22. Speaker Kim Ford and online speaker Mary Mysing-Gubala presented on this ordinance.

- Topic: Amendment to Ordinance No. 33,520 M.C.S.

- Topic: Elimination of Section 6-39(d) in City Code
- Summary: An ordinance to amend and reordain Section 6-39 of the City Code, eliminating the requirement that monies collected pursuant to Chapter 6 be applied to satisfy outstanding municipal liens before being applied towards outstanding ad valorem taxes. The ordinance was continued until later in the meeting.

- Topic: Sale of Property in Metairie Park Subdivision
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the sale of a certain portion of ground in Metairie Park Subdivision, which is no longer needed for public purposes, at public auction for a minimum price set by appraisal. The ordinance was adopted with 5 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: 33670
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)

- Summary: The ordinance seeks to amend Section 6-39 of the City Code to eliminate a requirement related to the application of monies collected for violations of various ordinances and codes. The ordinance was amended and the details of the amendment are available in the provided link.

- Topic: Ordinance Calling for Election on November 8, 2022
- Summary: This ordinance calls for an election to approve an amendment to the Home Rule Charter requiring Council approval of any person appointed by the Mayor or Chief Administrative Officer to head any office, unit, department, commission, or board. It specifically covers various appointments and provides with respect thereto.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,625 - BY: COUNCILMEMBERS MORRELL AND MORENO
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: As Amended - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)

- Tags/Keywords: Election, Home Rule Charter, Appointment, Amendment

- Topic: Conditional Use for Secondary Educational Facility in Historic Urban Districts
- Summary: The ordinance proposed the establishment of a conditional use to allow components of a secondary educational facility in specific historic urban districts. The speakers and online comments included both opposition and support for the ordinance, with notable speakers expressing their stance on the issue. An amendment was proposed and passed, with no opposition. 
- Ordinance Number: 33668
- Votes Summary:
    - Amendment: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment to the ordinance was passed, indicating support for the establishment of the conditional use for a secondary educational facility in the specified districts.
- Tags/Keywords: Conditional Use, Secondary Educational Facility, Historic Urban Districts
- UID: 17e31b46-53fc-4e9d-990b-25b7e82d35c6

- Topic: Limiting Mayor's Power to Suspend Article X
- Summary: This ordinance aims to limit the power of the Mayor to suspend Article X of Chapter 2 of the Code of the City of New Orleans. It was continued to the meeting of 5/5/22 and referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,671
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)

- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend and reordain Section 58-36 of the Code of the City of New Orleans regarding the establishment of election precincts. It was continued to the meeting of 5/5/22 and referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,679
- Votes Summary:

- UID: 21131374-d193-4243-8eda-db312c9a5169

- Summary: This ordinance aims to create and define the crimes of permitting premises for prostitution and concealment of prostitution in the Code of the City of New Orleans. It was continued to the meeting of 5/19/22 and referred to the Criminal Justice Committee.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,680
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Not available
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 5/19/22 and referred to the Criminal Justice Committee
- UID: 21131374-d193-4243-8eda-db312c9a5169

- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the Parish of Jefferson for the operation and maintenance of a flashing beacon on Old Hammond Highway.

- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Right to Counsel for Tenants Facing Evictions
- Summary: The ordinance aims to provide a right to counsel for tenants facing evictions in New Orleans City Courts.
- Ordinance Number: 33682
- Votes Summary:
